article.headline: Dow Inc., Goldman Sachs share gains lead the way, but Dow flat
article.body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is flat Tuesday morning with shares of Dow Inc. and Goldman Sachs leading the way for the blue-chip average. The Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading at 28,149, unchanged from yesterday's close. Dow Inc.'s shares are up $0.93, or 1.9%, while those of Goldman Sachs have gained $3.69 (1.8%), combining for a roughly 30-point boost for the Dow. Also contributing significantly are Chevron CVX, -1.62%, IBM IBM, -2.81%, and JPMorgan Chase JPM, -0.57%. A $1 move in any of the Dow's 30 components equates to a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
